ThingDef.label: Mousekin Ear
ThingDef.description: A biological Mousekin ear, most likely harvested from a dead or unwilling Mousekin.\n\nBesides allowing Mousekins to pick up quiet, distant sounds, large rounded ears represent a Mousekinâ€™s personal honor, dignity and standing in their society, and this replacement ear fully restores their loss of hearing ability as well as their social status.

ThingDef.label: Mousekin Tail
ThingDef.description: A biological Mousekin tail, most likely harvested from a dead or unwilling Mousekin.\n\nLike ordinary non-humanoid mice, Mousekins use their tails for balance while moving, and this replacement tail fully restores their loss of balancing ability.
